intro: Ionidium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ionidium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in width. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
